body: Burglars who stole a video camera and other property from a day care center at a Brooklyn synagogue left behind a swastika drawn on a wall, the police said yesterday. They said the break-in occurred between 7 P.M. Thursday and 6 A.M. yesterday at the Shellbank Jewish Center, at 2121 Bragg Street, near Marine Park. Stereo equipment and a telephone
title: METRO NEWS BRIEFS: NEW YORK; Burglars Rob Synagogue, Leaving Swastika Behind

body: Outside the Marine Park Funeral Home in Brooklyn, where friends and relatives gathered yesterday for the wake of a fallen firefighter, Christopher M. Bopp, a tall somber man in the dark dress uniform of the New York City Fire Department smoked a cigarette and fought back tears. ''Chris always wanted to do this job,'' Tom Wallace, a firefighter for
title: In Grief for 'the Good Guys,' Painful Family Lessons

author: William R. Everdell teaches history at St. Ann's School in Brooklyn and is the author of ''The First Moderns.''
body: THE NEIGHBORHOODS OF BROOKLYN Introduction by Kenneth T. Jackson. John B. Manbeck, consulting editor. Illustrated. 246 pp. New Haven: Citizens Committee for New York City/ Yale University Press. $29.95 More like a catalogue than an encyclopedia, ''The Neighborhoods of Brooklyn'' consists of short illustrated chapters on 47 big-city neighborhoods, a
title: Artful Dodgers

body: ATTRACTIONS Museums and Sites ABIGAIL ADAMS SMITH MUSEUM, 421 East 61st Street, Manhattan. The structure, built in 1799 as the carriage house for the estate of Abigail Adams and Col. William Smith, was also the Mount Vernon Hotel from 1826 to 1833. ''What's in a Name? The Story of Abigail Adams Smith,'' an exhibition of paintings and documents, is
title: SPARE TIMES

body: In a modest corner of the Marine Park section of Brooklyn is a modest home where a modest couple string Christmas lights in the winter and plant tomatoes in the spring. You couldn't find better people than Clement and Margaret Rispoli, their neighbors say. The street is a picture of postwar Americana. The Rispoli house is a brick two-story, valued
title: 'Common Folk' Pledging Their Homes to Free Gotti's Son

body: CORY-Elsie (nee Holman). On August 29, 1998. Beloved wife of the late Reverend David M. Cory, Pastor of the Homecrest Presbyterian Church. Loving mother of Arthur Cole and Stephen Cole. Dear sister of Jay Holman, Roy Holman, and the late Alfred Holman. Funeral and religious services Tuesday, 10 AM, at the Marine Park Funeral Home, 3024 Quentin
title: Paid Notice: Deaths CORY, ELSIE

body: Just a few years ago, Lincoln Terrace Park, a green expanse on the edge of Crown Heights, Brooklyn, was overrun with weeds, prostitutes and drug dealers. But these days, the 18-acre park is crowded on summer weekends as thousands of people flock there to watch their favorite players pass, shoot and score. They are not gathering to watch basketball,
title: A Court Ruled by Women; With Netball, Immigrants From Caribbean Turn a Derelict Brooklyn Park Into a Haven

body: In 1945, when Maud Esther Dilliard wrote a book about Brooklyn's Dutch Colonial houses, there were 40 of them left. Today, 14 remain, only half of them on their original foundations. Among the survivors is the Hendrick I. Lott House, an 18-room clapboard farmhouse, on East 36th Street between Fillmore Avenue and Avenue S, that dates to 1720. For
title: NEIGHBORHOOD REPORT: MARINE PARK; A Farmhouse With a Future

body: On Tuesday, the best source for a weather prediction in the New York region was, of all places, the Metropolitan Opera's press office. All day the weather reports on radio and television warned that thunderstorms were coming, which would have forced postponement of that night's concert performance of Rossini's ''Barbiere di Siviglia'' in Central
title: MUSIC REVIEW; An Opera Unvexed By Predictions of Rain Or the High Humidity

body: Two Brooklyn teen-agers were killed and another was injured when their car sped through a stop sign in Marine Park yesterday morning, hitting a sport utility vehicle carrying a mother and her two children, the police said. The driver, Christopher Roldos, and one of his passengers, Anthony Rich, both 18, both died at Coney Island Hospital, said
title: METRO NEWS BRIEFS: NEW YORK; 2 Teen-Agers Are Killed In a Crash in Brooklyn

body: When Cory Henkel pushed her daughter, Kyra, in the baby swing at Bleecker Playground in Greenwich Village, they would draw a sea of stares from children and adults alike. ''Their awkwardness was understandable,'' Ms. Henkel wrote in a letter to the Department of Parks and Recreation, asking that at least one special swing be installed to
title: NEIGHBORHOOD REPORT: NEW YORK UP CLOSE; Fighting for the Right To Swing With the Crowd

body: By yesterday's end, City Councilman Noach Dear had been through a grueling battery of events. He spent much of the day making official his candidacy to succeed Representative Charles E. Schumer in the Ninth Congressional District, taking his announcement to three locations: Brooklyn College, a boardwalk in Rockaway, Queens, and a Manhattan park
title: Councilman Is Fourth to Seek Congressional Nomination

body: Jane Dechongkit, 16, returned home from school in Mill Basin, Brooklyn, Tuesday afternoon to an unusual find and a stern warning. A clear plastic trash bag with two pieces of garbage -- an empty hand lotion bottle and a cardboard toilet paper roll -- was paraded in front of the befuddled high school student by her mother. Attached to the bag was a
title: Householders Caught With Incorrect Garbage

body: Two of southern Brooklyn's major real estate companies agreed last week to stop posting ''For Sale'' signs in an area that includes Mill Basin, Bergen Beach and Marine Park. The companies, Fillmore Realty and Tracey Realty, said they would take down all existing ''For Sale'' signs and adopt a voluntary moratorium on putting up new ones. They also
title: NEIGHBORHOOD REPORT: MARINE PARK; Two Big Realtors Unplug Panic Button: 'For Sale' Signs

body: Just as the United States Senate race has generated a torrent of campaign contributions, so too has the race to succeed Representative Charles E. Schumer, with City Councilman Noach Dear taking a dramatic lead over his three major rivals in fund-raising. Mr. Dear, who represents the Borough Park section of Brooklyn, raised $397,600 in the three
title: Race for Seat Of Schumer Grows Costly

body: SATURDAY is not Nathilee Caldeira's Sabbath, yet she feels a certain reverence for the day. As Orthodox Jews dressed for worship walk to synagogues, she and other blacks in the neighborhood go about their business. They do so with an understanding that it is a sacred day. ''Somehow on Saturdays, nobody really gets crazy,'' she said. Sunday is Ms.
title: Old Places, New Faces

body: HOFFMAN-Eleanor M., L.H.S. (nee Bischoff). Devoted wife od Dr. George J. Beloved mother of Dr. Roger G. and Arlene McGillick. Dear cousin of Nancy, Robert, Thomas, Lauren, Sharon and
title: Paid Notice: Deaths HOFFMAN, ELEANOR M., L.H.S. (NEE BISCHOFF)

body: IT'S 1:20 on a recent Wednesday afternoon and Darryn Tilden, a pilot for Delta Air Lines, has just come off the ice at Chelsea Piers' Sky Rink. Leaning on his two hockey sticks, breathing heavily and dripping sweat, he says that most players at these noontime pickup hockey games are just out for ''a good relaxing lunchtime skate.'' ''And every now
title: MAKING IT WORK; On an Oasis of Ice, Common Denominators

author: Mimi Sheraton is a former restaurant critic of The New York Times whose latest book is ''Food Markets of the World'' (Abrams).
body: As a lover of beach resorts out of season, I cherish most the Boardwalk in winter. Anyone who asks which boardwalk clearly did not grow up in Brooklyn, Truman Capote's ''mythical dominion against whose shores the Coney Island sea laps a wintry lament.'' This is my favorite getaway from December to April, an exquisitely lonely, secret land's end of
title: The Boardwalk in Winter? Absolutely

body: EDGELL-James C. On February 3, 1998. Beloved husband of Mary Jean (nee Leighton). Loving father of James L., Donald C., and Katherine C. Edgell. Cherished grandfather of six. Funeral Friday 8:30 AM, from the Marine Park Funeral Home, 3024 Quentin Road, Brooklyn. Mass at St. Brendan's R.C. Church, 9:30 A.M., interment St. Charles Cemetery.
title: Paid Notice: Deaths EDGELL, JAMES C.

body: As the campaign for United States Senate is starting with a torrent, the race to succeed one of the candidates in that race, Representative Charles E. Schumer, is moving at an equally rapid pace. Coveted by five elected officials, the Congressional seat is already the subject of a hard-fought campaign in what is likely to be one of the most
title: A Tough Race Is Expected for 5 Seeking Schumer's Seat
